channel.title: Copy of Digg top 24 hours
channel.description: RSS feed with direct links to popular technology articles. based on superdigg pipe

item.title: [+2805] If Sarcasm Ruled the World
item.description: If there's one thing we could use more of, it's sarcasm. Sure it's a barrel of laughs when the guy behind you in line to tells you to 'Take your time!' But wouldn't it be great if the ATM could give you crap as well?

item.title: [+2284] Windows 7 Review: You Can Quit Complaining Now
item.description: Could Windows 7 accomplish everything that's expected of it? Probably not, but it makes a damn good run at it. We've tested the gold master, the final version going out on October 22. Upgrade without trepidation, people. With excitement, even.

item.title: [+2061] This is why I'm scared of swimming! [PICS]
item.description: Tigers are powerful swimmers, capable of travelling up to 4 miles in the water and commonly seen carrying their kills across lakes...

item.title: [+1948] Lost Generation (Watch the Whole Thing)
[+1689] To the edge of space in a spyplane!
item.description: James May from Top Gear U.K. takes an emotional ride to the edge of space in a U2 spyplane. Amazing.

item.title: [+1536] CNN Refusing To Run Health Care Ad Critical Of Insurance
item.description: The network — already taking criticism for declining to run an ad criticizing Lou Dobbs — is now refusing to run an ad nationally criticizing the insurance industry, the group that tried to place the ad tells me.CNN’s reason: The ad “unnecessarily” singles out a top insurance industry executive by name for criticism.

item.title: [+1454] "WTF"......Horse Plays Chicken -- Leaps Moving Car
item.description: This video is just insane: A horse somehow galloped into traffic in Israel yesterday -- and successfully hurdled a car that was driving directly towards it, crushing the front windshield in the process.

item.title: [+1401] Are You Going to Have Sex on this Date (Flowchart)
item.description: When you're out on a date, it's hard to avoid wondering whether or not the night is going to end with you having sex. we've created this handy flowchart to help you determine whether or not your going to have sex at the end of your date.

item.title: [+1388] If you look closely, you'll see a Smart Car (PIC)
item.description: Although the name, at this point, may seem a little ironic.

item.title: [+1256] How NOT to wash your car
[+1131] TMZ: John Hughes Dies
item.description: John Hughes has died of a heart attack. Hughes suffered the heart attack while taking a morning walk during a trip to NYC to visit family. He directed such hits as "The Breakfast Club," "Pretty in Pink," "Sixteen Candles" and "Ferris Bueller's Day Off."

item.title: [+1002] Ridley Scott & DiCaprio to Make 'Brave New World'
item.description: The "Blade Runner" director is joining forces with Leonardo DiCaprio to take on one of the most highly regarded dystopian works of literature, Aldous Huxley's "Brave New World." Both are producing the Universal project, which DiCaprio would tentatively star in and Scott direct.

item.title: [+863] Official Drug Disposal Technician [Pic]
[+791] Fire in the Sky (PIC)
[+756] White House Encroaching on First Amendment - Fishy emails
item.description: A Republican senator is calling for the White House to suspend a new project that asks members of the public to flag fishy claims about President Obama's health care plans, arguing that it raises privacy concerns and will serve to chill free speech.

item.title: [+729] Interesting Chromium Bug Report - I see "some guys head"
[+708] Naked Homeowner Breaks Burglar's Jaw With a Baseball Bat
item.description: As an intruder rummaged through his living room and his two children slept upstairs, Tim Maynard stood near a doorway, naked and armed with a baseball bat…

item.title: [+703] Hiroshima calls for TOTAL ABOLITION of nuclear weapons
item.description: The Japanese city of Hiroshima today marked the 64th anniversary of the world's first atomic attack as its mayor called for the total abolition of nuclear weapons in the coming decade.

item.title: [+683] The Many Faces of Serial Killers
item.description: 28 serial killers. Hundreds of horrific murders. From the famous ones like Son of Sam and Charles Manson down to the more obscure, Life.com takes a pictorial look at some of the worst known monsters of the human race.

item.title: [+669] WTF: Korean Freestyle Rollerblading
item.description: Skip ahead to 0:50 for the magic to begin.
